title: Amaranth Tabouli
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Amaranth Tabouli a try. This recipe makes 4 servings with 385 calories, 9g of protein, and 22g of fat each. For $3.55 per serving, this recipe covers 30% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have amaranth, tomatoes, chopped/minced parsley, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 93%, this dish is great. Similar recipes are amaranth yogurt parfait â€“ popped amaranth parfait with fruits, red amaranth sambar , easy red amaranth sambar, and Tabouli.
instructions: Heat amaranth in a skillet over low heat, stirring constantly, until the grains start to pop and the amaranth is fragrant (1-2 minutes). Transfer to a small pot and add the water. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until most, if not all, of the liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and allow to rest for 5 minutes, covered.                                  Cool the cooked amaranth, then combine with the rest of the ingredients. Stir well to combine, taste for seasonings, and serve.

steps.step: Heat amaranth in a skillet over low heat, stirring constantly, until the grains start to pop and the amaranth is fragrant (1-2 minutes).
Transfer to a small pot and add the water. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until most, if not all, of the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and allow to rest for 5 minutes, covered.
Cool the cooked amaranth, then combine with the rest of the ingredients. Stir well to combine, taste for seasonings, and serve.
